name: land use change, pasture, man made | land use change, pasture, man made | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19877/documentation

This dataset represents the impacts associated to 1 ha of land use change (LUC), split between change from annual cropland, perennial cropland, primary forest, grassland, pasture man made, sugarcane and forest intensive. This dataset is specific to the country and to pasture, man made.;The dataset further includes the (management practice specific) occupation impacts, i.e. the loss of soil organic carbon (SOC) - based on SOCref values of Bernoux, 2001  and  stock change factors of IPCC, 2006,  weighted according to management and climate categories occurrence per state (Novaes, 2017) - and nitrous oxide (N2O). The types of exchanges, their emission and calculation factors and mathematical relations are the same from land transformations datasets 'land use change, annual crop, BR, 2010 - 2015' and 'land use change, perennial crop, BR, 2010 - 2015', available in Ecoinvent database (Rossi, 2017a,b).;The amount of this product to take into account as input to the crop inventory is dependent on the percentage of expansion and productivity of the specific crop in the Brazilian state considered. The percentage of expansion can be retrieved from Novaes, et al 2017, Appendix S2, tab 'Search results', box 5. More details in the Ecoinvent's Consideration of LUC report. ;Bibliography is listed below:;- Bernoux, M., Carvalho, M. D. S., Volkoff, B., & Cerri, C. C. (2001). CO2 emission from mineral soils following land-cover change in Brazil. Global Change Biology, 7, 779–787.;- Brazil (2016) Third National Communication of Brazil to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change – Volume III. Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation, Brasília.;- IPCC (2006). 2006 IPCC Guidelines for national greenhouse gas inventories, prepared by the national greenhouse gas inventories programme. Eggleston H.S., Buendia L., Miwa K., Ngara T. and Tanabe K. (eds). IGES, Japan.;- Novaes RML, Pazianotto RA, Brandao M, Alves BJR, May A, Folegatti-Matsuura MIS. 2017. Estimating 20-year landuse change and derived CO2 emissions associated with crops, pasture and forestry in Brazil and each of its 27 states. Glob Change Biol. 23:3716–3728 .doi.org/10.1111/gcb.13708;- Rossi V, 2017a, land use change, annual crop, BR, Undefined, ecoinvent database version 3.3. Accessed in September, 2017;- Rossi V, 2017b, land use change, perennial crop, BR, Undefined, ecoinvent database version 3.3. Accessed in September, 2017

The activity starts with the consolidation of the country specific land use changes: land transformation from primary forest, grassland, existing annual cropland, existing perennial cropland, existing sugarcane, existing pasture man made and existing forest intensive,  to pasture, man made.

Included processes: land use changes (in kg NPP0), C and N emissions due to soil occupation (i.e. SOC change.)
This activity ends with the addition of land occupation-related inputs and emissions (C in soil or biomass, CO2 from air, CO2 to air and N2O to air)
Emissions from peat oxidation by drainage, gross energy and other emissions related to organic soils are not considered, because of its small representativeness in Brazil (Brasil, 2016, page 143).
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0162:Support activities for animal production

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
From the data of Novaes et al., 2017, the only extrapolation is the convertion of land use areas  to land use change production volumes. More details about this can be found in the PV_comment.

Exchanges emission factors are the same from land transformations datasets 'land use change, annual crop, BR, 2010 - 2015' (Rossi, 2017a) and 'land use change, perennial crop, BR, 2010 - 2015' (Rossi, 2017b), thus extrapolated from a national level to state level.

exchanges.description: Yield = 1.0 ha. Activities related land use change of pasture, man made, including clear-cutting (of grassland and primary forest), land already in use and emissions due to soil occupation.

flow.name: land use change, pasture, man made
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0162:Support activities for animal production

exchanges.description: Emissions from SOC change in mineral soils, excluding peat oxidation. Carbon organic in ground in kg C.ha-1.yr-1 divided by 20 years converted to CO2 (44/12). In the case of carbon emission (positive SOCdif value) the flux is towards the air; in cases of carbon sequestration (negative SOCdif value), the flux is towards the soil.

flow.name: Carbon dioxide, to soil or biomass stock

exchanges.description: SOC change, excluding peat degradation. SOC of previous uses weighted by the production volumes of each previous land use minus SOC of reference product, divided by 20 years. SOC values derived from Appendix S1 from Novaes et al. 2017. In the case of carbon emission (positive SOCdif value) the flux is from the soil and biomass; in cases of carbon sequestration (negative SOCdif value), the flux is from the air.
Land tenure, arable land, measured as carbon net primary productivity per hectare per year. The average value for Latin America is 8110 kg C.ha-1.yr-1 and is divided per 20 years.

flow.name: land tenure, arable land, measured as carbon net primary productivity, pasture, man made
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0162:Support activities for animal production
